metadata.dc:description: There are various methods of cocaine consumption:intranasal, intravenous or inhalation. According to themethod used can produce varying complications. It iswell-known that intranasal cocaine consumption cancause the destruction of the nasal septum, however, thismethod of consumption can also cause lesions moreaggressive and that can affect different structures withinthe otorrinolaringology area, thus requiring a differentdiagnostic differencial with the systematic illnesses of themiddleline. We present the case of a 48 year-old woman,without a previous record of cocaine abuse, that went tothe hospital because of difficulties in swallowing anddistortion of her speech. The TAC revealed the existence ofa large destruction of the nasosinusal tract. The patienteventually confessed her addiction to intranasal cocainethat she had previously denied
